text: {{Infobox writer | name = Robinson Jeffers | image = Robinsonjeffers (cropped).jpg | caption = Jeffers, July 9, 1937 | birth_name = John Robinson Jeffers | birth_date = | birth_place = Allegheny, Pennsylvania | death_date = | death_place = Carmel, California | occupation = Poet and environmentalist | signature = Robinson Jeffers signature.svg | alma_mater = Occidental College }} John Robinson Jeffers (January 10, 1887 â€“ January 20, 1962) was an American poet. He was known for his work about the central California coast. His works were about the environmental movement. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== ==Other websites== *Western American Literature Journal: Robinson Jeffers * The Robinson Jeffers Association *Robinson Jeffers from The Poetry Foundation site * Robinson Jeffers at the Academy of American Poets. * Robinson Jeffers bio at Modern American Poetry Category:1887 births Category:1962 deaths Category:American poets Category:American environmentalists Category:Writers from Pennsylvania
title: Robinson Jeffers
